intro: Acnistus breviflorus f. indutus, commonly known as the velvetleaf acnistus, is a variant of the acnistus plant characterized by its dense, hairy foliage. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, short hairs, giving the plant a velvety texture. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
